results.title: Enemy at the gates [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Annaud, John Schofield and Mandalay Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1942 with World War II raging, the battle for Stalingrad becomes a focal point for the Nazi war against Europe and in particular Russia. A simple farm boy and talented sharpshooter named Vassili gains notoriety for his ability to kill German military officers. Danilov, a Soviet political propagandist working for Krushchev builds Vassili into a military hero in order to boost flagging military morale. In retaliation the Nazi’s send their best sniper, Major Koenig, to Russia to kill Vassili, who has become a symbol of potential Russian victory. As Koenig and Vassili set trap and counter-trap for each other, Danilov and Vassili come to loggerheads over a Russian soldier Tanya, whom they both love. Set in a spectacularly decaying city, “Enemy at the gates” successfully evokes the gruesome brutality and chaos of World War II as well as the ruthless machinations of the Russian propaganda machine. Purportedly the most expensive production to be shot in Europe, the film stars Jude Law, Bob Hoskins, Rachel Weisz, Joseph Fiennes and Ed Harris.

results.title: Hedwig and the angry inch
results.creator_credit: John Cameron Mitchell, Christine Vachon, Katie Roumel, Pamela Koffler, New Line Cinema and Killer Films
results.brief_description: Written, directed and starring John Cameron Mitchell, and based on his award-winning Off-Broadway musical, “Hedwig and the Angry Inch” is a startling and moving musical about difference and love. Hedwig started life as a boy in East Germany but when he falls in love with an American GI, he makes the ultimate sacrifice, by cutting off his genitalia to an “angry inch”. Unfortunately, all the GI offers Hedwig back in the USA is life in a trailer park. Hedwig uses his ample imagination to write songs but credit for them is taken by his nemesis (and one true love), Tommy Gnosis (Michael Pitt II). While Hedwig is forced to tour second-rate restaurants and night clubs, Tommy Gnosis has become a huge star. Hedwig won’t rest till Tommy acknowledges both his love and his debt. Featuring an electrifying performance by Mitchell in the title role, and a wonderful set of songs which manage to pay homage to both punk and old theatrical musicals, “Hedwig and the Angry Inch” is a defiant celebration of independence and gender confusion. Made on a miniscule budget, the film boasts inventive art direction and design. Mitchell’s perseverance and courage has paid off. The film has won numerous international film awards including a special prize at the Berlin Film Festival 2001 and the Audience Award and the Best Director Award at the Sundance Film Festival, 2001.

results.title: The American Film Institute salute to Fred Astaire
results.creator_credit: Marty Pasetta, George Stevens Jr and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: This series from the American Film Institute (AFI) salutes some of the biggest stars that helped to shape the face of Hollywood as we know it today. Fred Astaire whose career as a dancer, actor and singer is honoured here with the AFI’s Lifetime Achievement Award after a career of more than 77 years and a screen career of more than 40 films. This remarkable and versatile actor whose reputation was established in the films made with actress and long-time dance partner Ginger Rogers is joined by his colleagues in a celebration of his contribution to film including excerpts from the films, ‘The Gay divorcee’, ‘Top hat’, ‘Funny face’, ‘Swingtime’, ‘On the beach’, ‘Finian’s rainbow’ and ‘The Towering inferno’ to name a few. David Niven hosts the event with speaking guests including: Mikhail Barishnikov, Cyd Charisse, Barrie Chase, Bob Fosse, Audrey Hepburn, Charlton Heston, Gene Kelly, Hermes Pam, Eleanor Powell and Leslie Caron.

results.title: Beloved
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Demme, Oprah Winfrey, Edward Saxon, Gary Goetzman, Kate Forte, Clinica Estetico, Harpo Films and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Jonathan Demme (The Silence of the lambs, Philadelphia), “Beloved” is adapted from Toni Morrison’s Pulitzer Prize and Nobel Prize winning novel. “Beloved” is the story of Sethe (Oprah Winfrey), a free black woman living in Ohio in the 1870s, trying to come to terms with her violent and brutal experiences as a slave to white land owners. Sethe’s history is revealed in a series of brief flashback sequences: her rape, torture, escape, birth of her children, and witnessing of despicable deeds wrought upon her family. Living with her young daughter, Denver, Sethe is visited by a friend from the past Paul D (Danny Glover). Paul and Sethe were slaves on the same plantation and share knowledge of the evil wrought upon each other and their families. Paul and Sethe seek a kind of peace together, cautiously unburdening their darkest memories. Into Sethe’s house one day, arrives the mysterious, beautiful Beloved (Thandie Newton) a young woman who has, by turns, a menacing and sweet demeanour. Beloved strikes a bond with Sethe and Denver, whilst resenting Paul. Sethe seeks to understand the meaning of Beloved’s presence in her life, and to reconcile her personal demons.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jonathan Demme, Oprah Winfrey, Edward Saxon, Gary Goetzman, Kate Forte, Clinica Estetico, Harpo Films and Touchstone Pictures

results.title: Sweet smell of success [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alexander Mackendrick, James Hill and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This film noir has been well described as, ‘a rat trap of a film’, a compelling portrayal of corruption in which an unscrupulous small-time press agent, intent on clawing his way to the top, debases himself for the favours of a monster of a newspaper columnist. While it does not involve murder, the degree of manipulation and self deception is truly noir. Sidney Falco, the agent, is ultimately a more sympathetic figure because the cold bloodedness and self-righteous egomania of the columnist, J.J. Hunsecker, sets Falco’s faint glimmerings of self-disgust into relief. Susan Hunsecker, the object of her brother’s repressed incestuous desire, is the one figure who provides some moral bearings and delivers the retribution that J.J. fears. New York locations, aided by James Wong Howe’s night photography and Bernstein’s limpid jazz score, have never seemed bleaker. Featuring Burt Lancaster, Tony Curtis, Susan Harrison, Screenplay, Clifford Odets and Ernest Lehman from the novelette by Ernest Lehman.

results.title: State and Main
results.creator_credit: David Mamet, Sarah Green, El Dorado Pictures, Green/Renzi, Filmtown Entertainment and Fine Line Features
results.brief_description: Written and directed by David Mamet (The Winslow boy, The Spanish prisoner) “State and Main” is a humorous tale about the making of a big-budget Hollywood film in small town USA. Walt Price is a director in pre-production for his latest flick, “The Old mill” and plagued by problems. Having fled New Hampshire under a cloud, Price and his production team arrive in Waterford, Vermont, assuming that local inhabitants will be a pushover. Among Price’s hurdles are: leading man Bob Barrenger, whose hobby is picking up underage girls; leading actress Claire who has decided not to reveal her breasts for this particular film; writer Joseph Turner White who’s script has to be altered as the old mill has burnt down, making his title (and much of his script) redundant. Some locals take to the interlopers, but others seek to manipulate them to make a buck. Town folk include Ann, an amateur writer who assists White with his screenplay; Carla, a teenager with designs on Barrenger; and George Bailey, the mayor intent on making his town famous. “State and Main” is layered with numerous stories about the creation of a Hollywood film. Starring Phillip Seymour Hoffman, Rebecca Pidgeon, William H. Macy, Sarah Jessica Parker and Julia Stiles.

results.title: A Bug's life [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Lasseter, Kevin Reher, Darla Anderson, Pixar Animation Studios and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A Bug’s Life is a perfect example of how technology can be used to tell a good story. The computer generated animation from this Pixar film is amazing, but what makes it watchable are the gorgeous characters and enthralling story. When Flik endangers the future of the ant colony, Princess Atta sends him away to find help. A gang of grasshoppers- led by the menacing Hopper, will return by the end of the summer to accept the colony’s offering, which will take the colony the whole summer to collect. Flik runs into a group of circus performing insects who he mistakenly thinks are warriors. Will the colourful troupe and Flik be able to save the colony from Hopper’s wrath? Includes the voices of Kevin Spacey, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Phyllis Diller, Denis Leary, Madeline Kahn and Roddy McDowall. The film also includes the Pixar animated short, “The Game”, which won the 1997 Academy Award for Best Animated Short.

results.title: Fantasia [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An animated feast of music and visuals. Featuring a soundtrack of classical music, including selections by Bach, Tchaikovsky and Moussorgsky, the film weds animated narratives to the famous musical pieces. “Fantasia” includes one of Disney’s most loved sequences, “The Sorcerer’s Apprentice”. At its best the film’s animation remains magical and visually breath-taking.

constellations_other.name: Circling expanded cinema
constellations_other.description: Explore how expanded cinema like Lis Rhodes' Light Music connects to film composers, experimental materials and virtual reality.

results.title: Nell [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted, Jodie Foster, Rene Missel, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Egg Pictures and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment
results.brief_description: Jodie Foster is mesmerising in her role as Nell, a woman raised in an isolated wilderness. When her mother dies, Nell is forced to face a whole new world of discovery, fear and people who want to strip her of her once protected innocence. Her precarious journey into modern society is carefully monitored by Dr. Jerome Lovell (Liam Neeson) and psychologist, Paula Olson (Natasha Richardson), who are moved by Nell’s special untouched spirit and purity. Cast also includes Richard Libertini, Nick Searcy, Jeremy Davies and O’Neal Compton. Based on the play “Idioglossia” by Mark Handley.

When her mother dies, Nell is forced to face a whole new world of discovery, fear and people who want to strip her of her once protected innocence. Her precarious journey into modern society is carefully monitored by Dr. Jerome Lovell (Liam Neeson) and psychologist, Paula Olson (Natasha Richardson), who are moved by Nell’s special untouched spirit and purity. Cast also includes Richard Libertini, Nick Searcy, Jeremy Davies and O’Neal Compton. Based on the play “Idioglossia” by Mark Handley.
description_for_label: Jodie Foster is mesmerising in her role as Nell, a woman raised in an isolated wilderness. When her mother dies, Nell is forced to face a whole new world of discovery, fear and people who want to strip her of her once protected innocence. Her precarious journey into modern society is carefully monitored by Dr. Jerome Lovell (Liam Neeson) and psychologist, Paula Olson (Natasha Richardson), who are moved by Nell’s special untouched spirit and purity. Cast also includes Richard Libertini, Nick Searcy, Jeremy Davies and O’Neal Compton. Based on the play “Idioglossia” by Mark Handley.

results.title: Ocean's eleven
results.creator_credit: Lewis Milestone, Warner Bros Pictures and Dorchester
results.brief_description: Danny Ocean (Frank Sinatra) gathers together a group of ex-army buddies for an ambitious heist - the robbery of several casinos on New Year’s eve. His gang include playboy Jimmy (Peter Lawler), lounge lizard Sam (Dean Martin) and garbage man Josh (Sammy Davis Jnr) among others. At the time of production these very actors made up the crew known as the Rat Pack. Led by Sinatra, the Rat Pack were infamous for their carousing, womanising, drinking, entertaining and swinging image and in this film they do not stray far from their real life personas. “Ocean’s eleven” is not a film that treats the heist genre seriously in that it lacks any real tension of great films of that type. Rather, the film’s joys are derived from its 1960s aesthetic, the machinations of the sartorial Rat Pack at play, and the musical numbers courtesy of Davis and Martin. Also stars: Angie Dickinson , Cesar Romero, Shirley MacLaine, Joey Bishop and Red Skelton.
